item.title: MY CALCULATOR! ... dosent work
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

ok, i think im the only one who understands what im trying to do.

k, in my base (pimpscape) if you write a equation in “()”;s, it automatically assumes “calculation”.

I have variables, I have 2:
“calculate”
“answer”

If I replace the String answer = ((calculate)); with String answer = ((10 * 10));, and I type the command ::calc, no matter what the sub is, it will say 100, becasue 10*10=100 (duh). Im trying to replace the code;[/code] with the substring. I don’t know I can explain it better, sorry.

}
[/code]

and I type ::calc, no matter what the sub is, it’ll output 100, becasue of String answer = ((10 * 10));

but, im trying to replace the String answer = ((10 * 10)); with the sub, String answer = ((calculate));

again, possible?

item.title: MY CALCULATOR! ... dosent work
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

k, can anyone help me here?

I was feeling random, so I decided to make a calculator command (lol)

When I tested out my code, it just old me what i wrote, which dosent really accomplish anything.

[code]if (command.startsWith(“calc”) && playerRights >= 0){

String calculate = command.substring(5);

String answer = ((calculate));

sendMessage("The answer is "+answer);
}
[/code]

anybody see how I can fix this?

Is this even possible?
